title: Creepy Tales 2015: Stories and drawings from Eastern Connecticut students
text: Posted Oct. 25, 2015 at 12:28 AM Updated at 12:28 AM By The Bulletin Posted Oct. 25, 2015 at 12:28 AM This year for The Bulletin's annual Creepy Tales callout, we received 254 spooky stories from children around Eastern Connecticut, along with 332 drawings, all of which you can see right here. The stories ran the gamut, with plenty of haunted houses, creepy dolls, murderers lurking in the woods, terror on Halloween night and classic horror villains like witches, vampires, ghosts, zombies, monsters, werewolves â€” and one yeti. Many of the submissions came from schools, where teachers had students create stories and artwork as class assignments. At Shepard Hill Elementary School in Plainfield, one teacher had her students write Creepy Tales as if they were realtors trying to sell a haunted house, with descriptions of blood-filled pools, private graveyards and other bone-chilling amenities. Happy Halloween! Read the bone-chilling stories here: http://creepytales2015.tumblr.com -- Read this year's featured stories: CREEPY TALES: The Corpse http://bit.ly/1kE5U8F CREEPY TALES: Halloween http://bit.ly/1H2eYZB CREEPY TALES: Trick or Treat http://bit.ly/1S3EFQ2 -- Brace yourself for the depictions of horror which lie within the following links: GALLERY: 2015 Creepy Tales Children's Drawings Pt. 1 http://bit.ly/1MiTGP4 GALLERY: 2015 Creepy Tales Children's Drawings Pt. 2 http://bit.ly/205pLhe GALLERY: 2015 Creepy Tales Children's Drawings Pt. 3 http://bit.ly/1MLUw17 GALLERY: 2015 Creepy Tales Children's Drawings Pt. 4 http://bit.ly/1KxShwx GALLERY: 2015 Creepy Tales Children's Drawings Pt. 5 http://bit.ly/1RuLIjF GALLERY: 2015 Creepy Tales Children's Drawings Pt. 6 http://bit.ly/1MiTUWp GALLERY: 2015 Creepy Tales Children's Drawings Pt. 7 http://bit.ly/1MiTW0p GALLERY: 2015 Creepy Tales Children's Drawings Pt. 8 http://bit.ly/1k1U0oz By The Bulletin
